definitions.definition: to tell somebody that something is definitely true or is definitely going to happen, especially when they have doubts about it
definitions.sensetop: assure somebody (that)…assure somebody (of something)assure somebody + speech

examples.text: You think I did it deliberately, but I assure you (that) I did not.
Let me assure you that I will try to help you.
We were assured that everything possible was being done.
She's perfectly safe, **I can assure you**.
We assured him of our support.
I won’t let you down, I can assure you of that.

definitions.definition: to make yourself certain about something
definitions.sensetop: assure yourself of somethingassure yourself that…

examples.text: He assured himself of her safety.
She assured herself that the letter was still in the drawer.

definitions.definition: to make something certain to happen

examples.text: Victory would assure a place in the finals.
Victory would assure them a place in the finals.
This achievement has assured her a place in the history books.

definitions.definition: to insure something, especially against somebody’s death

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French assurer, based on Latin ad- ‘to’ (expressing change) + securus, from se- ‘without’ + cura ‘care’.
